[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Timestamp Manipulation] timestamp_difference calculated as (current_timestamp - last_update_timestamp) / 1000 - can clock timestamp be manipulated to inflate interest calculations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Compound Interest Overflow] calculate_compounded_interest for new_borrow_index - can timestamp_difference be large enough to cause overflow in exponential calculation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Treasury Amount Calculation] treasury_amount = ray_mul(ray_mul(total_borrow, index_diff), reserve_factor) - can nested ray_mul cause precision loss or overflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Index Update Atomicity] new_borrow_index and new_supply_index updated together - can partial update cause index mismatch leading to accounting errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Timestamp Wraparound] If clock timestamp wraps around or goes backwards, can timestamp_difference become negative (underflow) causing incorrect interest? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state_of_all()] [Clock Consistency] Same Clock reference used for all reserves - if clock timestamp is updated during execution, can inconsistent timestamps be applied? (Medium)
